website_summaries.verdict: A bit higher in price than some other brands, but one that stands out for being extremely easy to use and clean.
pros: The Lunette model has been rated as being more comfortable than some of the other brands on the market, and it also gets top marks for its ease of insertion and removal, as well as its easy-to-clean design
Customers feel it is worth the cost
cons: The cost may be a con for some, as it runs more than twice as much as some of the economy versions

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: No matter how many times I use this, or how I put it in, or how deep or shallow, it does not keep the blood in. I've been using this for 4 months now. Nope, I'd rather use tampons again. I use size 2 since I've had 3 kids. This is the second type of cup I've tried. I've watched videos on how I may be doing it wrong. I've checked the website. Not happy with the results. I want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Cleer

customer_reviews.title: Bye Bye Tampons and Pads!!
customer_reviews.text: **DISCLAIMER** Make sure before you try the cup the first time, go on YouTube and watch some videos from "Put A Cup In It" or "Itsjustkelli", both have great cup videos. That said, this is the BEST product that I have ever used. I am an athlete and run/cycle/swim/yoga/lifting and a prior tampon/pad user. Swapped it out for the Lunette Cup recently. Super comfortable and can't feel it in. No leaks at all. I didn't have any problems inserting or removing. Most of all, I love that this is eco-friendly and re-usable. If you are thinking of trying a cup, this Lunette is AMAZING!!! I will be buying a second cup as a back up. Love Love Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: SamuraiGirl

customer_reviews.title: #1 Brand
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand time and time again and it has never let me down. High quality material and perfect shape. I have never had a child but I still prefer the larger size due to how much I bleed AND because the small size just doesn’t seem to work with the shape and angle of my cervix. But I’ve never had a single leak. Directions are easy to follow. Cleaning is a breeze. Even comes with a cute little back to keep them discreet when not in use. Make sure to clean thoroughly at the end of each cycle. But you won’t regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MandyK

customer_reviews.title: Best one I've tried so far!
customer_reviews.text: This cup has saved me a couple hundred dollars by now! I only buy a single package of thin pads once every three months or so. It works great and every girl should have one. I don't worry about leakage at night at all anymore. Other than the first day, I only have to empty it once about every 10 hours Ann's mostly forget that I'm even on my period. The instructions don't include the best folding technique though. I've heard it called the petal punch or pinch.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Made periods so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: I love using this cup every month. I no longer have to waste money on tampons or pads and I don't have to wonder what is going in my body with over the counter tampons. This cup replaces all of them. Money saver and environmentally friendly, it is worth the purchase. I pull out my cup every time i shower to make the clean up and re-inserting process easy on me. The cup wont fill up as fast as you think and will cut the amount of tampon changes you might have now, down to only having to mess with it once a day. You wont regret giving this cup a try!
customer_reviews.author: Curly Crystal

customer_reviews.title: So happy I switched!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I switched to a menstrual cup. I was very nervous, having used pads and tampons since I started using them as a teen. But, I have been really trying to use less waste and came across this idea. Not only do I feel better about the essentially zero waste I create, but I used to get cramps and have not had that since starting. I can’t say for sure it’s related, but I’m certainly not complaining!
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: Model 2 review, watch YouTube tutorials!
customer_reviews.text: I use the model 2 and watched several YouTube videos on how to properly use these. I love it! I will never go back to tampons, these are fabulous, comfortable and convenient. I work in healthcare, where even after I've washed my hands I don't want to touch my bits more than I have to, and these have made my life so much easier. I'm never afraid its going to leak or overfill, I have a normal to heavy flow (depends on the day) and I never really notice I'm wearing one. I cut the tail off, as close to the base as possible. Try it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Get familiar with the directions first
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut the entire stem off the bottom because it was hurting me but from what I have read some women don't need to do this. My cervix must sit a little low because the stem was protruding out of me and it was very uncomfortable. I practiced a few times first to make sure I could grasp the cup and break suction before cutting off that stem and I can't feel it at all. I thought it was easy to use and remove after reading directions and getting a feel for it.
customer_reviews.author: balisong

customer_reviews.title: I did choose the wrong model for me and I didn’t use it
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner of buing my 1st menistural cup But i buy the model 2 ,i didn’t use it because it scared me because its too thick,and I didn’t give bith or get married,so after i do research I found that model 1 is most suitable for me..and now I cannot retun back this item because the return period is over..
customer_reviews.author: shaimaa

customer_reviews.title: Life changing
customer_reviews.text: I researched a ton and my sister reccomended this brand. There was a definitely learning curve so don’t give up. I’ve been using this now for 3 months and each time it gets easier. I have had 4 babies so I ordered the larger size. Initially, I didn’t think it would work BUT after I practiced I got better and better. You don’t have to change a tampon every few hours and it’s better for you. Also, no more purchasing tampons!
customer_reviews.author: Shanna Collaso

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, sturdy cup that stays in place (but a bit big for me)
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the larger size for capacity's sake, but wish I would have chosen the smaller one. The instructions said it doesn't matter if you've had children or not (I haven't) but I found this larger size somewhat uncomfortable to insert and remove. That being said, after I get it situated, it stays in place much better than other 'softer' cups that I've used and the suction is good. It expands easily. After trying reusable menstrual products (both pads and cups), I will NEVER go back to disposable. I love that while using this cup, I still feel 'clean', which I never do when using conventional pads.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Weiner

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use, hard to put in the right way. Easy to clean. I am not really a fan, if you can get it to work I am sure it would do well. It leaks for me though and it is uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Useless on heavy days
customer_reviews.text: Slips down on my heavy days. It’s an absolute pain. Switched back to tampons because it’s useless. On my lighter days it’s great.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Robison

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: The silicone is extremely hard and difficult to fold. Once it’s inserted GOOD LUCK getting it out. 15 minutes in the bathroom at work pinching and pulling and pushing. Changing positions, pulling like my life depended on it. The seal WOULD NOT BREAK. I basically had to rip it out of me and the silicone nubs on the stem left me really sore for a few days after. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT. I bought Flex cup after to try it and it’s amazing! Night and day difference. Don’t buy this. Get the Flex Cup!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get the right size
customer_reviews.text: I think I got the wrong size because it was so uncomfortable. I am going to give it another try but with a smaller size. I thought I had a heavy flow so I got the biggest size. I learned quickly that my flow isn't as heavy as I thought.
customer_reviews.author: Tatyana Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Make the switch!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor and make the switch! I waited a bit to write this review- using it for the 2nd time (cycle) and I couldn't be happier. It takes a little getting used to (for me it was a day or 2), but it's definitely worth it. This is a much more natural form of protection, I feel cleaner, and I'm happy about the positive impact this will have on the environment. I even worked out with it yesterday and all was well. This is a sturdy, quality made product. I bought it with the Lunette Cup cleanser and they are a winning combination!
customer_reviews.author: N. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very rigid!
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure it is fine but not what I was looking for. I have a Diva cup which is a little too rigid. I also have a Lily Cup which I LOVE but it doesn’t hold enough. I was looking for soft with decent volume. I asked if this was softer than the Diva Cup and people responded yes. It is NOT. it is a very rigid cup and still doesn’t hold quite the same volume as the Diva Cup. Very disappointing given that I asked first.
customer_reviews.author: E. Savage

customer_reviews.title: Too firm for me, worked well
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cup, just didn't work well for my body - it was too firm and had too much suction, making it very hard and painful to remove. It did work well - no leaks! Intimina Lily, a softer cup, worked better for me personally (but this may work well for others).
customer_reviews.author: Ekoostikhebrew

customer_reviews.title: Painful to remove! Stiff!
customer_reviews.text: So stiff!!! I dont know if I got the wrong size but it was so stiff, it was hard to manipulate when pulling out. Many times it snapped open when i was pulling it out, resulting it being uncomfortable and painful. I was used to my old cup that was smaller and not as stiff. Ill say that since its large i could leave it all day wothout changing. Used it for one period dont think ill use again.... perhaps its very for women who have given childbirth or something, as a 25 year old women who hasnt had children it was very umcomfortable when removing.
customer_reviews.author: maria carvallo

customer_reviews.title: been a good idea all around
customer_reviews.text: I have been a cup user for over a year. Switching from tampons, with all their toxic and environmental impacts, been a good idea all around. I will not deny that there is a very steep learning curve that involves locks doors, messes and whole new explorations of your anatomy the likes of which you have not seen since giving birth or learning how to use a tampon. But ladies, this is the product that should've been! Be sure that it "clicks" or "vacuums" in place. You can find tutorials all over the web as well as other reviews you help you learn how to use this product if you are intimidated. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: momonono

customer_reviews.title: Happy!
customer_reviews.text: My best friend!! Take one cycle or 2 for used correctly, no leak if you have control how is your flow( especially the firts days) after you know this gonna be your best friend, you don’t feel you are in cycle!
customer_reviews.author: Jehimy Martín

customer_reviews.title: Baby
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Divacup 2 and it was too long and uncomfortable, thought I’d try this one since it’s shorter and it fits much better. I was worried it’d be too stiff but it’s not bothering me any. Also the suction on this bad girl caught me by surprise but I just had to learn how to put it in slightly differently.
customer_reviews.author: Butt farts

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing they are not as dirty as some would think ...
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing they are not as dirty as some would think and are so comfortable you forget you are even wearing one. They are easiest to insert at the right angle if you do it while sitting down, then slightly twist and pull down to make sure it is snugly in place. I purchased my first one a while ago unfortunately is disappeared in my move, so I purchased another one ASAP. I recommend these to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Leaked, messy, wish it worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: Is there a magic trick to this cup I just don't get? Every time I used it, I was sure I put it in right... I read up a lot on it, talked to my friends that use them and I can feel what's going on... Yet I always had issues with leaking. It was messy pulling it out and as someone who tends to leave the house (ha!), this was super inconvenient to deal with... Not public/work bathroom friendly at all. Wish I loved it, but back to tampons I went.
customer_reviews.author: Allison30Something

customer_reviews.title: So glad I switched!!!
customer_reviews.text: My sister recommended Lunette to me, I was a tad hesitant to try it, but I did. BEST thing I could have done !!!! You hardly know it's there, does exactly what description says it does. Now ladies I know it can't be difficult changing from tampons/pads to reuse able menstrual cups, give it a try, you won't be disappointed. Of course with everything new comes some challenges, rest assured I'm sure all of the ladies that have made the switch overcame some of the problems you think you might have using the cup. I hope this helps you. :)
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Haven't quite figured it out....
customer_reviews.text: As much as I want to love it, after re-readking some other reviews maybe I need to trim the tab since I find it a bit uncomfortable . I have a tipped uterus and have messed around with the angle and although when removing it the suction seems super tight, it still leaks. The one good thing I do have to say is that if you have toddlers following you into the restroom, this has been great. No more questions about what is that string, etc. Since you can keep it in longer than tampons I just wait until I do get a free moment alone to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gringa Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I finally broke down and bought a menstrual cup and it’s the best purchase I’ve made in a while. It takes a little trial and error to get it exactly right but honestly tampons are the same way. But cups are better for your pH and so comfy. Overall I’m really satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Rockk

customer_reviews.title: Worth the trouble?
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is an environmentally wise choice but I had great difficulty getting it out in the mornings, the suction was so strong. Removing it was tricky due to slipperiness (I once dropped it into the toilet just as it came out, so had to boil it all over again). It was comfortable while wearing it though, and you can go longer without worrying about leakage. It is possible this just isn't the model for me, but I hate to spend more money on other models/brands trying to find the perfect fit. Something with a longer tab might suit better though.
customer_reviews.author: AMagicalMind

customer_reviews.title: Very hard to remove!
customer_reviews.text: It works ok, but it's very hard to remove. If it's correctly positioned, I can't get it out without a seriously messy struggle. If it's not in the correct spot, I can get it out, but it leaks. I don't use this cup, I ordered a different band that has a loop that makes it easier to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher G

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have tried sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Was kind of skeptical when I ordered this, but I'm glad I did. Tampons left irritation for a week or more after my period so I was looking for something different. No irritation, no leaks, and it's really not very messy at all. Took a bit to get used to putting it in and getting it out, but was pretty easy to get the hang of it. I would definitely recommend trying this. Also I am 33, have 3 c-section babies and the larger size works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly K

customer_reviews.title: Better for me than the moon cup US
customer_reviews.text: About a year ago I decided to buy a cup and got the moon cup US. It was better than tampons but I still leaked as I have a very heave flow and it will move during the day and then I had to reposition it or it would hurt. The lunette is much better as it fits me better and it does not move, also it holds a heavier flow plus its pretty color means it will not color itself which became very unatractive. However this is a highly personal decision so please do some research to see what size and type is better for your body!
customer_reviews.author: travelsina

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product. It took me a couple of cycles to get the hang of insertion and removal, but now I can do both quickly. I completely removed the stem, as it was poking me. It leaked one time, in the very beginning when I was still trying to get proper insertion figured out. I love it because it totally removes the "bad smell" aspect of my period and because I don't have to be worried about toting tampons around with me.
customer_reviews.author: dhillparks

customer_reviews.title: Great For Everyone With a Va-jayjay!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this menstrual cup!! I love not having to buy other feminine products. I love how simple it is. I love that it last longer than other feminine products. U highly recommend this to every one with a Va-jayjay! I'm a wildland firefighter and I hated having to pack around used feminine products. This makes life on a fire line so much easier. Just have a water bottle and hand sanitizer to keep things as hygienic as possible when you need to empty it.
customer_reviews.author: deedubs14

customer_reviews.title: First Menstrual Cup
customer_reviews.text: This was an interesting experience using for the first time but I found that I needed to trim the stem. I don’t really get why they have a stem since you don’t use it to pull out. But you don’t even need it unless you have a high cervix I guess. Really glad I got this cup!
customer_reviews.author: Scotti Wilkerson

customer_reviews.title: love love love
customer_reviews.text: I cut the stem off and now it's perfect. I wish someone had told me about menstrual cups a long time ago; this has pretty much change my life. It was a little dusty out of the packaging, but the instructions say to boil before first use anyway so that was not a big deal. I love my Lunette and will be buying this brand again whenever my current one needs replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this today after a miserable experience with one called Leason. It was only $10 and I got what I paid for. After 3 months of struggling with it and spending literally 20 minutes the other day trying to get it to open I threw it away and ordered this one. I got it in correctly in about 4 seconds. Spend the extra money. It's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Many years of comfort.
customer_reviews.text: My trusty lunette needed replacing after many years of use so of course I replaced it with the exact product. Happy to see the price has gone down over the years but I would gladly pay the orginal price. So worth it for your convenience and pocketbook. Happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: EANDC

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: After trying out the Mooncup, FemmyCycle Cup, & the Intimia Lily Cup A Soft Cup, this Lunette Cup has now become my go-to cup for my menses. I only wish that I had discovered this cup initially, but you live & learn. I would highly recommend this cup to first time users.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Love my cup
customer_reviews.text: Love my cup, took me about two or three cycles to really get a hang for how often I needed to empty it out depending on the day of my cycle. On my heaviest days I've had to empty it out every 2 hours, like perfect clockwork, and I'll put on a panty liner for my own peace of mind. For my regular days I can leave it on all day without having to mess with it, it's great. Only keep pads and tampons on me in case of an emergency, otherwise I'm thinking about buying another one so that I can keep one in my purse, and at my place.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Changed how I view my period.
customer_reviews.text: Before this menstrual cup I would go through the worst time during my time of the month. Ruining underwear, bedding, etc. And the horrible diaper-like feeling of pads was not something to look forward to. Now I can go a shift at work without much worry or discomfort. There is def a learning curve to using a cup but there are websites dedicated to helping you figure it out. And I still have some leakage problems sometimes but no where near as bad as before. For more info I'd check out [...]
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Gold

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this after I had my first baby because ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after I had my first baby because my previous menstrual cup no longer fit me well... this one is a huge improvement! It is a bit shorter than the other brand I had been using so it no longer caused any irritation while wearing it. I did trim off the stem, but once that was gone, this cup worked perfectly! For people new to menstrual cups, there IS a learning curve, but don't give up!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Mahaney

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. The end pokes way out and pinches
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. The end pokes way out and pinches. I use another kind that does NOT do this. Owner emailed automatically checking on product. I explained my issues and never got a response. Even an I’m Sorry you are disappointed. Why send an email if you don’t plan on answering them?
customer_reviews.author: Sha

customer_reviews.title: scary experience
customer_reviews.text: Not a product for me. I must have put it in wrong, I started flowing extra heavy. No thank you.
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex Mama

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, vast improvement from tampons
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to tampons, this is amazing. Definitely takes some getting used to and getting up close and personal with yourself, and I would recommend using it at home on a weekend the first time, but this is just so much better when you get used to it. I did need to cut the tab part on the bottom off for maximum comfort for me.
customer_reviews.author: the breeze

customer_reviews.title: like flipping it inside-out
customer_reviews.text: When I first switched to menstrual cups, I was a devout Diva Cup user. It worked perfectly for me. But after I had my son, neither size worked. I tried a variety of suggestions, like flipping it inside-out, to stop the leaking and discomfort, but nothing worked. After a bit of research, I decided that the Lunette was the best choice, and I'm happy to say I was right! The first time using it, it easily went into place, is incredibly comfortable, and I haven't had to worry about leaks! I only needed to trim the stem, but aside from that, I love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Emma E.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I decided to try this! I have PCOS and my periods are extremely heavy and long :( I recently tried the Diva Cup and it was too small and also kind of uncomfortable. The Lunette is AMAZING. I feel extremely comfortable and I'm not worried about leakage. It's slightly larger than the Diva Cup but more comfortable. I am never going back to pads or tampons again. Once you get the hang of inserting and removing it, it's super easy and way more practical.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa V

customer_reviews.title: it takes practice
customer_reviews.text: it defiantly takes some practice tries. I was still spotting the first couple days and started to get frustrated, but then i looked on the company's webpage to see some trouble shoot questions and answers and figured out I was inserting it too far for my cervix and as soon as I corrected this it was amazing!! if you have been thinking of trying these wonderful items, do it, and don't give up too easily because once you get the hang of it..it's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: sb

customer_reviews.title: Greatest.invention.ever.
customer_reviews.text: It does take practice. But this is my first cycle using and after a couple tries of reviewing how to optimally insert, I am in love with this. No leaks. I forgot it was there. I had a much easier time of it than I ever have before. I won't go back to anything else. Ever.
customer_reviews.author: R Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Better than my diva cup
customer_reviews.text: I used a Diva for years but decided as long as I needed a new one I'd try a different brand. Comfy even without trimming the stem! Works great, love the color.
customer_reviews.author: LifeBreakingIn

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: This was a little too stiff for me. It made my cramps hurt worse and pressed on my bladder. The color was nice though to hide blood stains!
customer_reviews.author: #BuyerBeware

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for a firmer cup!!
customer_reviews.text: Only used it for 1 day so far so I'll update if there's any changes! I've used the d.i.v.a cup and after a few times boiling it, it lost its stiffness, this cup is so much better! Noticeably firm so it's easy to insert and flip open, you don't have to fidget around with it trying to get it to pop open! Just as comfortable as other cups, this is definitely my favorite! I feel since it's more firm it feels like it's definitely not going anywhere, better than other cups! Stem was a tad bit too long so I trimmed it down a little
customer_reviews.author: Robert L Baroldy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for me
customer_reviews.text: I had been using the Diva cup for about a year and decided to try this one out. The rim is not as stiff and is a shorter cup so I found it easier to place properly and more comfortable for my body. Cup is smaller (due to being shorter) than the Diva cup so if you have a heavy flow, you will have to empty it more often.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this product and have been very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product and have been very happy with it. It has saved me a lot of money on feminine products and is pretty convenient. I have a pretty heavy flow for the first couple of days but I can definitely go longer without emptying it than I could with tampons. You do need to plan ahead if you will need to use a public restroom to empty this. And I would recommend using a small panty liner with it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Schwarz

customer_reviews.title: Life changing!!!
customer_reviews.text: (Matt's wife here) These are so empowering! Comfortable, sustainable, budget-friendly, and I only need to empty it once every 12 hours (even on heavy flow days). I love my lunette and will never go back to tampons. There is a learning curve for sure-- it took me about three months to get the hang of proper placement. Once you do, though, it is a beautiful thing!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, convenient, great for travel!
customer_reviews.text: How can you not love an eco-friendly money-saver that's convenient, comfortable and much more sanitary? If you have a high cervix, leave the length on the end... It helps when you need to remove the product. Good luck with your menstrual cup venture! It's definitely worth the switch!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Save the dough, try this instead!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. (Pretty sure I received the pink one though) Enjoy not having to purchase feminine products over and over again. Takes practice, but have managed to be successful 100%. Lots of tips and tricks on multiple websites for ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Casey L

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: It’s uncomfortable at first until you learn how to use it. I love it very much and I’m glad I don’t have to spend money every month
customer_reviews.author: Grace Steinmann

customer_reviews.title: trying some ideas
customer_reviews.text: So far, it's okay. However, I got in touch with their customer service and they are doing EVERYTHING to make it work for me, including multiple email suggestions, ideas on what to try, full discussion on of my questions. I'm extremely impressed with the very quick customer service. I'll update after I try a few of their suggestions.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: I really do like it. The "stem" thing is crazy unnecessary & ...
customer_reviews.text: I really do like it. The "stem" thing is crazy unnecessary & not as soft when you cut it. It tucks up in there easily, but as the hours pass I feel it slowly sneaking out. Maybe too big of a size 💁🏼 Who knows.
customer_reviews.author: John McCurry

customer_reviews.title: Know your size cup.
customer_reviews.text: Before buying a menstrual cup you NEED to know your size, measure your cervix( there’s plenty of videos on YouTube). Great product, in my opinion, I think it’s better if you have low flow or regular, definitely NOT for heavy flows; other than that it’s just perfect! There’s really no smells whatsoever!
customer_reviews.author: magv 14

customer_reviews.title: This is such a wonderful product and the company provides tips and tricks for ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had taken the step to buy one of these earlier! This is such a wonderful product and the company provides tips and tricks for usage. It comes with a nice discrete bag that I will just grab and take with me when it's close to the start of my cycle. If you are sick of having to run to the store last minute, asking for a handout from people when you aren't prepared, and want to help out the environment, buy this product. The only downside is you have to get used to it and may need liners for your first few cycles, but you will feel so liberated once you get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole C.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My first cup that I ever bought or used. It gets time to get used to it but love how it works I'm interested in trying different brands because I still always feel a little uncomfortable. Idk if it's me or this cup. I like how it comes with a bag to put it in.
customer_reviews.author: boriquaa1130

customer_reviews.title: saving grace
customer_reviews.text: I have been using pads for years and it has been a struggle. I have very heavy periods for 2 to three days and would have to change pads at least 15 times per day on those days. Thanks to my Lunette Menstrual Cup I am able to actually do my work without running to the bathroom every half hour to check. No leakage. No worries. As pointed out, I'm still getting the hang of the insertion but after one cycle I can say that the Lunette cup works and I love it. So far I have introduce the cup to several of my friends and they are definitely going to try it. Thanks. Vanessa
customer_reviews.author: Nesser

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Lunnete Menstrual cup for 5 almost 6 years and have never used a different company. That being said I love my Lunnette cup! I use the larger model so I have to empty it less and have had no problems. What I like about this Lunnette cup is it's firm which is a plus for me. If your uncertain about trying a menstrual cup just think of it as a way to get to know your body and you can put in before your period starts!
customer_reviews.author: Tiff

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the wasteful products, get a cup!
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about this at first, and not gonna lie, it takes some getting used to. But in the end I am satisfied and glad I don't throw money at tampons/pads every month anymore. I am definitely interested in trying other brands to see how they differ. This is my first and only point of reference. But you should definitely try it out! Make the switch!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: BETTER THAN ANY OTHER CUP-EVEN DIVA! NO MORE TAMPONS!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE lunette. To all those "diva cup" queens- no. Lunette is the way to go. This is my second. (only bc I lost my first one :) ) AMAZING product. Easy to use. Pain free! ..if you've had intercourse, that is. If not- #1 I'd suggest model 1 no matter your flow and #2 By day 2.5-3 you'll get the hang and never turn back. I use model 2. I suggest using model 1 unless you have a serious heavy flow. These cups are so easy to use, much more sanitary than tampons, not bleached, not soaked in chemicals, and much less harmful to your body since they don't cork you. (sorry for the visual, but ew. No thanks tampons...)
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: bad at first but now i love
customer_reviews.text: i was so nervous to try it, a lot of reviews made me scared. Honestly the first time i tried it it hurt a lot. i just wasn't used to it. plus getting it out was so difficult that i thought it was going to be stuck in me forever! but i kept using it and now ive used it for four months and I'm in loveeee. its so easy and can stay in longer than a tampon. be sure to use extra backup liners on heavy days tho.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Was skeptical but I love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews I decided to give this a try. I am 43 and had 3 children so I was skeptical that this would work. It was comfortable and I had no leakage. It took a few tries to master removing it correctly but overall a great experience.
customer_reviews.author: Symone Board

customer_reviews.title: Suprised to be a fan.
customer_reviews.text: I had read a few advertisements and reviews about menstrual cups and was unsure if it was for me. But I found that by the second month I had been converted and find the whole thing easier and less stressful than I expected. Using the menstrual cup also seems to shorten the duration of my period. Their is a learning curve for using it comfortably and removing it easily, but by the second month I found I didn't need panty liners and I had been using them with traditional tampons previously anyway. I have already recommended it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan S McQuaide

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I love these cups. It is comfortable and safe for the body. I use it faithfully and love how it can be worn all day with no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Bjames9665

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I had a diva cup for awhile but I like this much better. It’s smaller and a little “stiffer” which makes it stay put better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Menstrual Cup convert for life!  Love my Lunette!
customer_reviews.text: I love this cup. I went with model 2, despite model 1 being the recommended one for my age group/history. There is a small learning curve, but it's totally worth it. Flexible, comfortable once in. I don't love the stem, but I resisted the temptation to cut it off and it became less noticeable (but still noticed) over time. I know people have successfully trimmed their stems, but I will leave mine be for now. Having this cup and reusable pads (my favorite: [...]), I am completely converted to reusables. The pads are simply insurance - I never had any problems with the cup leaking.
customer_reviews.author: prodigal_daughter

customer_reviews.title: Best cup I've tried.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Lunette. I've tried three other cups and this by far has been my favorite. It's a little stiffer than other brands but does the job Just like it's supposed to and holds up well. This Lunette was purchased to have a back up and because I wanted a new color (my original is green).
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. C

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found years ago.
customer_reviews.text: No leaks, easy to install (YouTube is amazing!), hygienic, and safe for running and pool.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to tampons and pads!
customer_reviews.text: I had to cut the string because it would stab me a little and was painful but it works well overall.
customer_reviews.author: Cino

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE for every woman!!
customer_reviews.text: BEST menstrual cup!!! Every woman on earth should own one- that is how much it changed my life!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Rademan

customer_reviews.title: I cannot say enough good things about this product
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say enough good things about this product! It does take a bit of getting used to, but definitely give it a try! It's especially good if you are trying to save money or the earth, as you won't have to buy so many products every month that you'll end up throwing away. It's very easy to clean (just some alcohol and then boil it for 20 minutes once a month). I would highly recommend this product to any woman; definitely a 5 star product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too rigid and uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Menstrual cups are a personal choice, but this one never worked for me. I think it was mainly the shape but also the silicone - it’s too rigid and never flexed to my body. I also have a tilted cervix so that may have impacted it as well. I purchased Saalt cups after a few months of discomfort with the lunette and they are far more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: June Bride

customer_reviews.title: Recommend highly!
customer_reviews.text: Great way to prevent waste every month. It’s very comfortable and has been a game changer!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Pokey nub!
customer_reviews.text: Let me just say that I love the menstrual cup as a method. I purchased this cup for the different (non-stainy) color, and yes, it’s adorable. However, the little nub sticks out too far so that, at times, if I sit just so, it pokes against my vulva. Currently wearing my first tampon in years.
customer_reviews.author: Colossus

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: I like these better than the diva cup. They are a little stiffer so they expand easier so less leaks. I only had to cut the stem a bit
customer_reviews.author: rmonica68

customer_reviews.title: but removing the cup is painful for me
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure it takes some getting used to, and I wonder if I should’ve ordered the smaller size, but removing the cup is painful for me. I have Endometriosis and an hopeful about sticking with this product and not subjecting my body yo harmful chemicals in pads/tampons.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Hall

customer_reviews.title: Awful, Painful, Do NOT Buy
customer_reviews.text: I finally tried this product and it was awful. The cup is extremely hard to fold like the directions show, and hard to keep folded. I tried to insert it and it snapped back to shape mid insertion causing me to scream in pain. I was in intense pain trying to remove the cup after it snapped open. I am now making an appointment with my doctor because the injury has not healed. Do not order this product.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Mascelli

customer_reviews.title: Why did it take me until age 25 to find this?!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, freeing, easy to use, not painful, not unsanitary. I'm so in love. Bye bye tampons!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: 1.top: S Lena bottom: L Lunette 2.left: L Lunette right: S Lena 3: left L Lunette right: L Lena 4)top:L Lunette,  L Lena
customer_reviews.text: I got the larger cup since I have a heavy flow. I also chose this cup because I read it was softer than the Lena. I have both large and small Lena cups. I get pretty bad cramps with the larger Lena cup and I constantly have to change the smaller cup (a lot leaking). But the larger Lunette cup is actually firmer than the Lena and also cause cramping. I would try the smaller Lunette but I am not willing to spend more money on another menstrual cup that I may not use. I guess the small Lena cup will do for now.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie H. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Avoid toxic shock
customer_reviews.text: Although using a large cup in my 40's, this still is not adequate for all my flow days. I use a panty liner just in case. Takes some getting used to, but overall a good product fit-wise and a good alternative for fiber products and their problems.
customer_reviews.author: SunnyRow

customer_reviews.title: Imagine that one scene from The Shining where it's totally ...
customer_reviews.text: Imagine that one scene from The Shining where it's totally silent - you're looking in on some sort of an elevator waiting room, decadent and austere. Suddenly, unmistakably, a wave of crimson envelops the pristine space, gushing and flowing so chaotically yet so completely - you are mesmerized by its finality, its power, its sublime wantonness. That's my period. This thing contains that. For hours. It paid for itself in 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: °

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This cup completely exceeded my expectations. It is easy to use and and super comfortable! I did have to trim my stem down some as my cervix sits a bit low but after I did I felt absolutely no discomfort. Much more comfortable and easier to use then a tampon. I have recommended this to all my female friends and family members.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but too stiff
customer_reviews.text: the material and the flexibility is too stiff, makes the experience of inserting it and pulling out unpleasant. It's not my first cup and this one is harder than the other. Other than that its okay.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Takes times
customer_reviews.text: Takes practice and patience to use properly. May take a few months to get use to it. Once I found out how to best place it I never noticed it. It is not about ease of use, it's about sustainability. Highly recommend. Saves you money, no health risks, and environmentally friendly!
customer_reviews.author: Josie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I researched a lot of different cups and this is the one that seemed closest to what I was looking for. I am so glad I made this purchase! I didn't think I would enjoy my cup as much as I do, but this is definitly something I would recommend to anyone considering making the switch from tampons and pads. I was surprised at how clean it is to use. I was afraid of making a huge mess when trying to empty it, but it is quite easy. There is a little bit of a learning curve, but once you get the hang of it, it works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hall

customer_reviews.title: So glad I tried it
customer_reviews.text: I was very hesitant about using a menstrual cup but I am so glad that I did. It took about 3 tries to be sure I had it right. From then on, no leaks, np discomfort... perfection.
customer_reviews.author: MomToOne

customer_reviews.title: I am 100% satisfied. I cannot feel it and the rigid material ...
customer_reviews.text: The Lunette is very similar to my Diva. The material is much more firm which made me worry that I would be able to feel it. Instead, I am 100% satisfied. I cannot feel it and the rigid material allows the cup to open completely without too much hands-on adjusting. Having a low cervix, I cut the stem off all the way to the base of the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Macadoodle

customer_reviews.title: so i'm sure it will be perfect later: ) easy to put in
customer_reviews.text: I got mine and today is my 1st day of using it. I have a really heavy flow so i have had to empty it out twice already because its full and its leaking. i purchased model 2. so i'm sure it will be perfect later :) easy to put in. no issues. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Irina B

customer_reviews.title: Lunette model 2
customer_reviews.text: This is my first cup so I have nothing to compare but so far, after 1 cycle, I love using this cup instead of tampons and pads. I can't feel it at all after an initial maybe 2 minute adjustment. I practiced with it in the shower a couple times before my cycle started so I got the hang of it before it got messy. The model 2 is a little stiff to bend and insert but after 2 kids, it's probably the one I need. Highly recommend this cup!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Jones

customer_reviews.title: Caused reaction
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the diva cup for years and decided to try something new, this gave me an allergic reaction. I have never reacted to anything before but this caused itchy and swelling within hours of inserting, not fun.
customer_reviews.author: Kerin Halper

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I love this cup! This was my first experience using a menstrual cup and it was a little daunting at first but once you figure out how to remove it properly this product is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Keiko

customer_reviews.title: Glad I found it.
customer_reviews.text: No leaking. I think there is an adjustment period...no pun intended... for getting used to it and also achieving proper positioning.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: Its day 2 of use. I am a 31 year old that has had 2 children and I weigh 140Ibs. I am wearing size 2. So far I can not feel it and have no leaks. The only con is that I had to trim the stem for comfort and that makes it a little difficult to remove.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Overflows sometimes depending on the position of my cervix. ...
customer_reviews.text: Overflows sometimes depending on the position of my cervix. Used it for 6 moths with minimal issues besides some leakage on heavy days. Just have to make sure it is positioned correctly!
customer_reviews.author: mel

product_meta.title: Lunette Menstrual Cup - Violet - Reusable Model 2 Menstrual Cup for Heavy Flow
feature_bullets: Better for your body, better for the environment. Lunette Menstrual Cups will provide you with a safe, comfortable, odorless period for up to 12 hours.
Easy to use, Lunette Menstrual Cups are a zero-waste alternative to tampons and pads, and can be used for up to two years.
Our Model 2 Cup is made of soft, medical grade silicone, and is perfect for a normal to heavy flow.
Made in Finland with the highest quality standards and love, all Lunette Menstrual Cups are chemical, latex and BPA-free.
All Lunette Menstrual Cups come with a storage pouch and step-by-step user guide.
